sections.heading: Establishment of the Department of Real Estate Services.
Notice and contract summary to the Council on certain contracts
Criteria for Council review and approval of certain contracts.
Establishment of District of Columbia Employee Parking Program Fund.
Old Naval Hospital Foundation grant authority.
Security assessments and implementation at District facilities.
District Facilities Planning Advisory Committee.
Funding.
sections.text: The functions of this chapter are to be funded in the amounts of $1.8 million in Fiscal Year 2004 and $1.1 million in Fiscal Year 2005 from the Public Planning Capital Project Fund established in § 1-325.11. Of this total amount, not less than $1.2 million shall be made available to the Department of General Services (“Department”), in consultation with the Office of Planning, for the development of a facility inventory and conditions assessment. Other amounts as required shall be transferred to the Department and other District agencies for the fulfillment of the provisions of this chapter. In all cases, this work shall be performed without the use of contractors, except where specialized expertise or expedited effort is required.

sections.heading: Definitions.
sections.text:
For the purposes of this chapter, the term:

(1) Repealed.

(1A) "Director" means the Director of the Department of Public Works.

(2) Repealed.

(3) "Place of public accommodation" shall have the same meaning as provided in § 2-1401.02(24).

(4) "Public restroom facility" means a restroom maintained by the District or an agent of the District and accessible to the public free of charge.

sections.heading: Establishment of working group and public restroom facility pilot.
Public Restroom Facility Program.
Rulemaking.
sections.text: The Mayor, pursuant to subchapter I of Chapter 5 of Title 2, may issue rules to implement the provisions of this chapter.

sections.heading: Public restroom partnership agreements.
sections.text: The Director may enter into an MOU, partnership, or cost-sharing agreement with one or more third-party entities to support additional public restroom facilities under the Department of Public Works's contract.

sections.heading: Definitions.
sections.text:
*NOTE: Pursuant to section 7085 of D.C. Law 25-50, this section applies only with respect to public restrooms managed or maintained by the District of Columbia Public Library as of October 1, 2023.*

Not Funded.

sections.heading: Provision of period products.
sections.text:
*NOTE: Pursuant to section 7085 of D.C. Law 25-50, this section applies only with respect to public restrooms managed or maintained by the District of Columbia Public Library as of October 1, 2023.*

Not Funded.

sections.heading: Applicability.
sections.text:
(1) Except as provided in subsection (b) of this section, this act shall apply upon the date of inclusion of its fiscal effect in an approved budget and financial plan.

(2) The Chief Financial Officer shall certify the date of the inclusion of the fiscal effect in an approved budget and financial plan and provide notice to the Budget Director of the Council of the certification.

(A) The Budget Director shall cause the notice of the certification to be published in the District of Columbia Register.

(B) The date of publication of the notice of the certification shall not affect the applicability date of this act.

(b) This act shall apply with respect to public restrooms managed or maintained by the District of Columbia Public Library as of October 1, 2023.
